leaflet.constituency: Bartley Green, Edgbaston, Harborne and Quinton

messages.title: LOCAL CAMPAIGNS...
messages.content: Parking is a huge problem. We have had several consultations yet no real answers. With the prospect of the Children's Hospital moving to the Women's Hospital, the problem is only going to get worse. I will put a petition of 5,000 signatures to the council to ensure the voices of Edgbaston residents are heard in the city.

messages.title: PRIORITIES...
messages.content:
Straight Talking - If I spoke to my patients in the way some politicians speak to the public, you would never trust me. I speak to my patients clearly, honestly and explain why I think what I do. That won't change as an MP.

The NHS - I will use my professional background to ensure the principles of the NHS remain: free at the point of contact and based on clinical need, not ability to pay. Ensuring Edgbaston gets the care it deserves.

Education - I will use my experience gained as a school governor and teacher at the University to ensure our children and young people get the best possible start to a life in Edgbaston.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Addressing the parking issues by putting forward a petition to ensure the voices of Edgbaston residents are heard.
Commitment to maintain the NHS principles of being free at the point of contact and based on clinical need, ensuring Edgbaston receives the care it needs.
Using experience as a school governor and university teacher to provide the best possible educational start for children and young people in Edgbaston.

issues.education: I will use my experience gained as a school governor and teacher at the University to ensure our children and young people get the best possible start to a life in Edgbaston.
issues.governance: Birmingham IS the second city. I will be the loud voice in government for Edgbaston and raise the profile of Birmingham on the national scene. We need a champion to represent our city and I am ready to lead in that role.
issues.health: The NHS - I will use my professional background to ensure the principles of the NHS remain: free at the point of contact and based on clinical need, not ability to pay. Ensuring Edgbaston gets the care it deserves.

housing.content: Parking is a huge problem. We have had several consultations yet no real answers. With the prospect of the Children's Hospital moving to the Women's Hospital, the problem is only going to get worse. I will put a petition of 5,000 signatures to the council to ensure the voices of Edgbaston residents are heard in the city.

leaflet.personalStatement: Trained here – works here – lives here

contactInformation.address: Printed by Printing.com, 87/89 Smallbrook Queensway, Birmingham B5 4JL

images.caption: Vote for Dr Luke to be your new Member of Parliament on May the 7th

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted by James Borron, on behalf of Dr Luke Evans, both of 5-7 Langley Road, Birmingham B29 6HR.
